data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the following instructions, the starting point is facing forward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Right after turning around, you follow directions to turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps and return back to the starting point. Take 10 steps and return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
At first you will just start walking and then take 7 steps and take 4 steps in each direction. The last step is to turn left and take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you were to follow the directions, and then turn left twice, you could return to the starting point in around five steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person cannot return to the starting point if they take 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes one action to get back there. The first step is taken at 8 and the last 4 are done at 9. So the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you return to where you started you first take 6 steps back. The answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first four steps are made in the direction that you always face forward. Once you take one step left, you are always facing away from the compass point. Remember it is not possible to take 4 steps forward and 6 steps forward at the same time. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take the steps you were given to turn around and take 2 steps. Take the steps you were given to take 3 and take 3 steps. Take the steps you were given to take 7 and take 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The sentence states: Always face forward. The sentence continues: Take 1 step backward. The sentence continues: Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

All instructions assume one always points to the starting point. To return to the starting point the same direction one left off was before starting forward there are two directions. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the instructions, you will always face forward. Taking 5 steps right is the same as taking 3 steps left. Taking 1 step backward is the same as taking 3 steps backward. Taking 6 steps left is the same as taking 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point you can always take 4 steps left. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One step backward is the same as one step forward. The starting point is facing forward and this can be seen from both ways. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around right and if at the starting point turn right. Then take 4 steps and turn right and turn around left. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 10 steps then take 9 steps to go back to the start point. Take 4 steps then take 6 steps to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The 7th step would start with 7 steps and 9th step would finish with 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning around means going back around to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you turn right, you go straight up. If you turn right, you go left. If you take 7 steps, you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turning left results in 6 steps. Take 1 step into this direction and turn the left way. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you take 3 steps, you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow the instructions, you are guaranteed to get back to the starting point if you take the 7th step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 8 steps left and take 7 steps forward in the correct sequence, then you will be back at the starting point. If you take 7 steps right and are directed towards the starting point, then you will be back at the starting point. All parts of the correct sequence refer back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Step 1: Facing Forward. Step 2: Move back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

There is a starting point at the beginning of this statement. An example for this is turn the corner of the circle back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

The instructions only ask to make sure you are always facing forward while the pictures only state you should always take 6 steps. So, the answer is no.

Turn around is to turn toward the direction of travel. Turn right is to turn around. So, the answer is yes.

If you face forward, and go backward, you would take 2 steps backward. If you take 2 steps backward, you would take 3 steps backward. If you take 3 steps backward, you would take 8 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You can take 4 steps back to the starting point. The answer: Yes.

You turn around by taking 9 steps and turing back around. So, the answer is yes.

You could squat down to make a small step if you are standing in front of the starting point facing forward. There would hardly be any steps taken at any of the different steps. The starting point is a little out in front of you. So, the answer is no.

If you take one step and then take another one, you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Forward and backward actions have different effects because they all take place in the same direction. It also takes different steps to return back to your starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow the instructions to the letter B, you will always take 5 steps left and take 1 step backward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take an extra step forward and take 3 steps backward, you return forward. If you take an extra step backward and take 4 steps backward, you return backward. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around repeats the steps one through ten except you take 10 steps to get back to the beginning. So, the answer is yes.

If you face forward, you will always take 6 steps forward. To return to a starting point, you would take 6 steps forward, 4 steps forward, and 1 step backward. So, the answer is yes.

Whether 5 steps are taken to take 5 steps or 7 steps are taken to take 7 steps. If you follow these instructions, you are reverting back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

You can face forward if you’ re- facing forward. In order to turn the other way, you must return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One is moving forward and one is moving backward. Forward and backward = opposite. Negative and negative = opposite. 2 steps backward is the same as taking 2 steps backward. 4 steps backward is the same as taking 4 steps backward. 6 steps forward is the same as taking 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around means return at the previous destination. Leaving the starting point involves turning around. The answer: yes.

They always face forward. If you take 12 steps backwards, you will take 12 steps forward. If you take 6 steps forward, you will take 6 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward and always take 5 steps right, and take 5 steps left, you always take 5 steps left and take 5 steps backward. If you always face left, that would only make you take 4 steps backward. There are 10 steps from right to left, 12 steps from left to right, 16 steps from right to left, 18 steps from left to right, and 24 steps from right to left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step you are facing forward and after taking 6 steps you are facing left away from your starting point. In the second step you are facing left and after taking 8 steps you are facing left again. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

On the second option, if you turn left, you return to the beginning point of the previous instructions. The inverse sequence is: Turn left, take 9 steps, take 3 steps, turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 9 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you will always return to the starting point. If you take 6 steps right and take a left, you will always take 6 steps right and take a left. If you take 5 steps left and take a right, you will always take 5 steps left and take a left. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The backward step is a backward step that is different from the forward step. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For each direction, you cannot return to the starting point. For each forward direction, you cannot return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Backward, you are facing the same direction as the person on your right. Forward, you are facing the same direction as the person on your left. So, the answer is yes.
